previous.name: Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 9
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 9

segments.pli: 2. Sīhanādavagga
segments.en: 2. The Lion’s Roar

segments.pli: 11. Sīhanādasutta
segments.en: 11. Sāriputta’s Lion’s Roar

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “vuttho me, bhante, sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāso.
segments.en: “Sir, I have completed the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, janapadacārikaṃ pakkamitun”ti.
segments.en: I wish to depart to wander the countryside.”

segments.pli: “Yassadāni tvaṃ, sāriputta, kālaṃ maññasī”ti.
segments.en: “Please, Sāriputta, go at your convenience.”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
segments.en: Then Sāriputta got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu acirapakkante āyasmante sāriputte bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: And then, not long after Sāriputta had left, a certain monk said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “āyasmā maṃ, bhante, sāriputto āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkanto”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, Venerable Sāriputta attacked me and left without saying sorry.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: So the Buddha said to a certain monk,

segments.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena sāriputtaṃ āmantehi:
segments.en: “Please, monk, in my name tell Sāriputta that

segments.pli: ‘satthā taṃ, āvuso sāriputta, āmantetī’”ti.
segments.en: the teacher summons him.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Sāriputta and said to him,

segments.pli: “satthā taṃ, āvuso sāriputta, āmantetī”ti.
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, the teacher summons you.”

segments.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto tassa bhikkhuno paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes, reverend,” Sāriputta replied.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno āyasmā ca ānando avāpuraṇaṃ ādāya vihāre āhiṇḍanti:
segments.en: Now at that time the venerables Mahāmoggallāna and Ānanda took a key and went from dwelling to dwelling, saying:

segments.pli: “abhikkamathāyasmanto, abhikkamathāyasmanto.
segments.en: “Come forth, venerables! Come forth, venerables!

segments.pli: Idānāyasmā sāriputto bhagavato sammukhā sīhanādaṃ nadissatī”ti.
segments.en: Now Venerable Sāriputta will roar his lion’s roar in the presence of the Buddha!”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “idha te, sāriputta, aññataro sabrahmacārī khīyanadhammaṃ āpanno:
segments.en: “Sāriputta, one of your spiritual companions has made this complaint:

segments.pli: ‘āyasmā maṃ, bhante, sāriputto āsajja appaṭinissajjacārikaṃ pakkanto’”ti.
segments.en: ‘Venerable Sāriputta attacked me and left without saying sorry.’”

segments.pli: “Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya.
segments.en: “Sir, someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, pathaviyaṃ sucimpi nikkhipanti asucimpi nikkhipanti gūthagatampi nikkhipanti muttagatampi nikkhipanti kheḷagatampi nikkhipanti pubbagatampi nikkhipanti lohitagatampi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā;
segments.en: Suppose they were to toss both clean and unclean things on the earth, like feces, urine, spit, pus, and blood. The earth isn’t horrified, repelled, and disgusted because of this.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, pathavīsamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like the earth, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (1)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, āpasmiṃ sucimpi dhovanti asucimpi dhovanti gūthagatampi … muttagatampi … kheḷagatampi … pubbagatampi … lohitagatampi dhovanti, na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā;
segments.en: Suppose they were to wash both clean and unclean things in water, like feces, urine, spit, pus, and blood. The water isn’t horrified, repelled, and disgusted because of this.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, āposamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like water, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (2)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, tejo sucimpi ḍahati asucimpi ḍahati gūthagatampi … muttagatampi … kheḷagatampi … pubbagatampi … lohitagatampi ḍahati, na ca tena tejo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā;
segments.en: Suppose a fire was to burn both clean and unclean things, like feces, urine, spit, pus, and blood. The fire isn’t horrified, repelled, and disgusted because of this.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, tejosamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like fire, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (3)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, vāyo sucimpi upavāyati asucimpi upavāyati gūthagatampi … muttagatampi … kheḷagatampi … pubbagatampi … lohitagatampi upavāyati, na ca tena vāyo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā;
segments.en: Suppose the wind was to blow on both clean and unclean things, like feces, urine, spit, pus, and blood. The wind isn’t horrified, repelled, and disgusted because of this.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, vāyosamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like the wind, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (4)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, rajoharaṇaṃ sucimpi puñchati asucimpi puñchati gūthagatampi … muttagatampi … kheḷagatampi … pubbagatampi … lohitagatampi puñchati, na ca tena rajoharaṇaṃ aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā;
segments.en: Suppose a rag was to wipe up both clean and unclean things, like feces, urine, spit, pus, and blood. The rag isn’t horrified, repelled, and disgusted because of this.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, rajoharaṇasamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like a rag, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (5)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, caṇḍālakumārako vā caṇḍālakumārikā vā kaḷopihattho nantakavāsī gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā pavisanto nīcacittaṃyeva upaṭṭhapetvā pavisati;
segments.en: Suppose an outcast boy or girl, holding a pot and clad in rags, were to enter a town or village. They’d enter with a humble mind.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, caṇḍālakumārakacaṇḍālakumārikāsamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like an outcast boy or girl, abundant, limitless, measureless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (6)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā;
segments.en: Suppose there was a bull with his horns cut, gentle, well tamed and well trained. He’d wander from street to street and square to square without hurting anyone with his feet or horns.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, usabhachinnavisāṇasamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: In the same way, I live with a heart like a bull with horns cut, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (7)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya;
segments.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and had bathed their head. If the corpse of a snake or a dog or a human were hung around their neck, they’d be horrified, repelled, and disgusted.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, iminā pūtikāyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.
segments.en: In the same way, I’m horrified, repelled, and disgusted by this rotten body.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyya. (8)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chiddāvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ;
segments.en: Suppose someone was to carry around a bowl of fat that was leaking and oozing from holes and cracks.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi chiddāvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, I carry around this body that’s leaking and oozing from holes and cracks.

segments.pli: Yassa nūna, bhante, kāye kāyagatāsati anupaṭṭhitā assa, so idha aññataraṃ sabrahmacāriṃ āsajja appaṭinissajja cārikaṃ pakkameyyā”ti. (9)
segments.en: Someone who had not established mindfulness of the body might well attack one of their spiritual companions and leave without saying sorry.”

segments.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then that monk rose from his seat, placed his robe over one shoulder, bowed with his head at the Buddha’s feet, and said,

segments.pli: “accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhiṃ.
segments.en: “I have made a mistake, sir. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of me to speak ill of Venerable Sāriputta with a false, hollow, lying, untruthful claim.

segments.pli: Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhatu āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā”ti.
segments.en: Please, sir, accept my mistake for what it is, so I will restrain myself in future.”

segments.pli: “Taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi.
segments.en: “Indeed, monk, you made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of you to act in that way.

segments.pli: Yato ca kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikarosi, taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
segments.en: But since you have recognized your mistake for what it is, and have dealt with it properly, I accept it.

segments.pli: Vuḍḍhihesā, bhikkhu, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī”ti.
segments.en: For it is growth in the training of the noble one to recognize a mistake for what it is, deal with it properly, and commit to restraint in the future.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta,

segments.pli: “khama, sāriputta, imassa moghapurisassa, purā tassa tattheva sattadhā muddhā phalatī”ti.
segments.en: “Sāriputta, forgive that silly man before his head explodes into seven pieces right here.”

segments.pli: “Khamāmahaṃ, bhante, tassa āyasmato sace maṃ so āyasmā evamāha:
segments.en: “I will pardon that venerable if he asks me:

segments.pli: ‘khamatu ca me so āyasmā’”ti.
segments.en: ‘May the venerable please pardon me too.’”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: After the rains season, Sāriputta takes leave of the Buddha. Another monk falsely accuses Sāriputta of hitting him before leaving. The Buddha calls Sāriputta to answer the accusation. Before the Saṅgha, Sāriputta denies it, uttering a powerful statement of spiritual prowess.
